image.altText: Three women and survivors of sexual abuse stand on a flight of stairs leading to the Maroochydore District Court.

items.synopsis: Four survivors of sexual abuse have told their story about a Sunshine Coast man who sexually assaulted them as children and how it severely impacted every aspect of their lives.

title.children: Decades after their abuse ended, four women unite to jail a paedophile

image.altText: Karen Kennedy and her son Aaron Kennedy

items.synopsis: A clinic with ties to a cult that teaches that disability is "karma" has received thousands of dollars under the NDIS scheme.

title.children: Aaron's carer, who was funded by NDIS, was part of a 'cult' that teaches that disabilities are 'karma'

image.altText: A portrait shot of a clean-shaven man with black hair, outdoors.

items.synopsis: NSW Premier Chris Minns announced in a snap press conference on Wednesday that Tim Crakanthorp will step down after a significant breach of the ministerial code.

title.children: NSW Premier refers cabinet minister to corruption watchdog, asks him to step down

image.altText: A woman takes a photo from a boat of an erupting volcano

items.synopsis: The Whakaari White Island trial hears from experts that a shipping container placed on the volcano "as a shelter" was of little value in the event of an eruption.

title.children: Tour operators placed a shipping container on Whakaari in the event of an eruption, court hears

image.altText: A young woman wearing a white winter coat sitting by a river, looking into the distance.

items.synopsis: Angela Williams only took part in one bodybuilding competition, but says the experience left her with years of health issues. She is one of several current and ex-competitors concerned about the strict dieting in the industry.

title.children: 'Glitzy' photos of bodybuilders on stage made Angela want to join them. She didn't see the health risks

image.altText: Human hands hold a Tasmanian devil joey

items.synopsis: Named Milo the Milestone Devil, the four-month-old joey was discovered during a regular pouch inspection, meaning the wildlife sanctuary has produced 500 joeys since it was launched on the mainland during 2011.

title.children: An 'absolute milestone' for Aussie Ark sanctuary as Milo the Tasmanian devil joey emerges in NSW

image.altText: South African players dance in celebration

items.synopsis: South Africa and Sweden progress from Group G. Later, Jamaica plays Brazil and Panama takes on France. Follow along in our live blog.

title.children: South Africa knocks Italy out of Women's World Cup, Sweden through as group winners

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: SOUTH AFRICA ARE THROUGH IN AN EPIC! What a game, what incredible fight from the South Africans to keep coming back. They had to win, and hope the other result was friendly, and it's all come together. That is their first ever win at the Women's World Cup, and it has taken them through to the knock-out rounds. Italy, quarter-finalists in the last World Cup, are out! What a game from Banyana Banyana, and Thembi Kgatlana in particular.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: FULL-TIME: South Africa 3 - 2 Italy

children.content: SOUTH AFRICA ARE THROUGH IN AN EPIC!
What a game, what incredible fight from the South Africans to keep coming back.
They had to win, and hope the other result was friendly, and it's all come together.
That is their first ever win at the Women's World Cup, and it has taken them through to the knock-out rounds.
Italy, quarter-finalists in the last World Cup, are out!
What a game from Banyana Banyana, and Thembi Kgatlana in particular.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Argentina are out, Sweden top the group. We know that much.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: FULL-TIME: Argentina 0 - 2 Sweden

children.content: Argentina are out, Sweden top the group. We know that much.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Italy in all sorts at the back and now South Africa are going through. Hildah Magaia burst into the box and laid it on a plate for Kgatlana to smash home. It's 3-2! What a game.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 90+2' SOUTH AFRICAAAAAAAAAAAAA! GOAL!!

children.content: Italy in all sorts at the back and now South Africa are going through.
Hildah Magaia burst into the box and laid it on a plate for Kgatlana to smash home.

image.altText: A house with police tape in front of it.

items.synopsis: Donald Morley fronts the ACT Magistrates Court via audiovisual link from his hospital bed, withdrawing a bail application.

title.children: Elderly Canberra man accused of murdering his wife will spend time in jail under special conditions

image.altText: Local residents being evacuated on a forklift during China's flooding.

items.synopsis: While 27 people are reported missing, many more are caught in the devastation caused by remnants of Typhoon Doksuri, which has battered northern China for four days.

title.children: 'Not enough time to evacuate': Contact lost with hundreds of residents trapped by floods in China

image.altText: Meg O'Neill speaking at Woodside Energy's AGM

items.synopsis: Two men are granted bail after going to the home of Woodside chief Meg O'Neill, allegedly with spray paint.

title.children: 'You have escalated your protest': Activists allegedly went to Woodside CEO's house with spray paint

image.altText: two images side by side. left: a finger pressing a numbered button on an engine immobiliser. right: woman standing in kitchen

items.synopsis: Car theft is set to become a lot harder in northern Queensland from today with the launch of $500 vouchers for drivers wanting to install car engine immobilisers.

title.children: Delour's car was stolen twice before she got an immobiliser. Now 20,000 people can install one, too

image.altText: A close up of Trump smiling in front of the stars of the American flag.

items.synopsis: The federal investigation of the former US president is just the latest criminal case against Donald Trump as he runs for the White House in 2024.

title.children: Can't keep up with Donald Trump's legal troubles? We're tracking his various investigations

image.altText: Donald Trump leans into the microphone as he speaks loudly behind a presidential lectern in front of the White House.

items.synopsis: Donald Trump has been formally indicted for a third time, over alleged attempts to overturn the 2020 presidential election that culminated in the January 6 insurrection. Here's what we know so far.

title.children: 'The defendant knew they were false': The key takeaways from Donald Trump's third indictment

image.altText: Unidentified child drawing.

items.synopsis: Gaye was sexually abused when she was a young child. Warning signs at the time were ignored or brushed under the carpet and when her fragments of memories of the abuse came together years later, she found she was still being "silenced".

title.children: Five-year-old Gaye drew men differently to other kids. Her drawings held a sinister revelation

image.altText: A man in a dark navy suit and pink tie speaks in parliament, with an Indigenous female minister sitting behind, watching on

items.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has claimed surveys show Indigenous Australians support the Voice at a rate between 80 and 90 per cent. Is that correct? RMIT ABC Fact Check investigates.

title.children: Fact check: Do the polls show that Indigenous support for the Voice is between 80 and 90 per cent?

image.altText: The statue is of a woman in nursing clothing, her hands clasped, Telstra Tower and a rainbow in the background.

items.synopsis: A statue of late Australian Army nurse Vivian Bullwinkel, who survived a massacre in WWII, is unveiled at the Australian War Memorial. But advocates have criticised the institution for failing to fund it.

title.children: 'Appalling' that Australian War Memorial didn't fund first female statue to be installed on its grounds, advocates say

image.altText: A power police with three wires, one of which has been cut.

items.synopsis: The state's biggest electricity distributor says thieves are putting their lives at risk by cutting down power poles to steal and sell copper wiring.

title.children: Copper thieves 'taking chainsaws and hacksaws' to power poles, say NSW police

image.altText: For sale sign at vacant land at house site.

items.synopsis: Deputy Premier Steven Miles says the Queensland government is also setting a target for 20 per cent of new builds to be social or affordable housing. He says the government is supporting additional development in West End.

title.children: 'Not another Sydney': 900k new homes planned for south east Queensland, most in existing urban areas

image.altText: A heritage building.

items.synopsis: Star Entertainment has pleaded guilty to a total of 11 charges, mostly for illegally allowing patrons to use credit cards to gamble in casinos in Brisbane and the Gold Coast.

title.children: Embattled operator Star Entertainment fined $140k for casino breaches

image.altText: An Australian Federal Police badge

items.synopsis: The ABC has confirmed that one of the man's employers was a childcare centre associated with a tertiary facility.

title.children: Former childcare worker charged with sex offences was known as 'unofficial photographer' at one facility

image.altText: The chief minister at a lectern with microphones and flags behind her.

items.synopsis: The anti-corruption watchdog closes its investigation into the $10 million taxpayer-funded investment in Darwin water bottle company NT Beverages without making any findings.

title.children: Chief minister silent on action after ICAC investigation into NT government investment

image.altText: Dr Justin Yerbury and a research assistant in a laboratory

items.synopsis: Renowned motor neurone disease researcher Professor Justin Yerbury, who led research into finding a cure before dying of the disease last Friday, is remembered in front of hundreds of mourners at a funeral service in Wollongong.

title.children: Australian science loses a 'shining star' as Professor Justin Yerbury is farewelled at funeral

image.altText: Convicted sex offender Bernard McGrath

items.synopsis: Findings from a New Zealand royal commission into a Catholic order that shifted a prolific paedophile between his homeland and Australia describe one school as "a place of depravity, sexual, physical and spiritual violence".

title.children: NZ abuse royal commission findings describe 'hell on earth' conditions for kids in care

image.altText: Jeremy Cameron clenches his fist and screams

items.synopsis: Geelong spearhead Jeremy Cameron is the victim of an "unprovoked" heatbutt in a local pub while watching cricket.

title.children: AFL integrity unit notified after Cats star Jeremy Cameron the victim of 'unprovoked attack' in pub

image.altText: A large concrete sign with letters saying National Gallery of Australia.

items.synopsis: The National Gallery of Australia says its independent review into controversial artworks from South Australia's APY Lands has cleared the works of improper interference, but said how the art collective operates was a matter for the SA government, which is running a separate inquiry.

title.children: National Gallery's independent review finds in favour of APY artists

subjects.title: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art

image.altText: A composite image of Teal MP Monique Ryan, NT Chief Minister Natasha Fyles and Independent Senator David Pocock

items.synopsis: The Northern Territory chief minister took aim at southern "teals and trolls spreading their nonsense" about plans to develop the north at a National Press Club address in Canberra.

title.children: Crossbenchers fire back at NT chief minister's 'teals and trolls' speech

image.altText: Close up of Queensland police logo on side of police car

items.synopsis: The driver is in hospital undergoing surgery for serious head injuries after being attacked by three men at Taringa in Brisbane's inner west.

title.children: Uber driver attacked with hammers during car theft, police say

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and glasses

items.synopsis: Investigative journalist Mark Willacy rejects accusations in court that he breached ABC editorial policies and the media union's code of ethics over stories about allegations of war crimes.

title.children: ABC journalist denies breaching editorial policies over war crimes allegations

image.altText: Logo Open AI is in white on black phone screen in front of a white computer screen with words.

items.synopsis: Spend enough time with ChatGPT or other artificial intelligence chatbots and it doesn't take long for them to spout falsehoods.

title.children: Chatbots sometimes make things up. Experts explain why and if it can be fixed

image.altText: Green racing car on winding road.

items.synopsis: Motorsport Australia's CEO says he is disappointed Targa will "go it alone" with the tarmac rally event without waiting for his organisation to implement new regulations following four competitor deaths in two years.

title.children: Motorsport boss stunned Targa to continue without governing body's blessing

image.altText: Peter Haxby walking into court.

items.synopsis: Peter Haxby is jailed for bribing a West Australian public servant in exchange for being awarded government contracts, totalling more than $1.1 million, for social housing projects.

title.children: Contractor jailed for giving $122,500 in bribes to public servant for government work

image.altText: Two brown kelpies smiling, their teeth and tongues are visible and their ears are up. They're sitting on green grass.

items.synopsis: A council's decision to not allow people to be buried with their pets in its cemeteries has been described as bizarre and heartless.

title.children: 'It's a human cemetery': People unable to be buried with pets under council policy

image.altText: A man slam dunking a basketball.

items.synopsis: A new documentary celebrating Luc Longley's three consecutive NBA championships, and featuring exclusive new footage from The Last Dance, will offer a fascinating insight into the Australian basketball legend.

title.children: Luc Longley steps out of Michael Jordan's shadow in new NBA documentary
